relevant_communication:
EU Design Days  
EU Design Days is a unique event enabling regions and their stakeholders from all over Europe to come together in order to exchange information and know-how about the added value of implementing design as a tool for regional innovation.  
The Slovenian Business & Research Association is actively involved in the coordination and execution of the event from start to finish. We help draft the communication strategy, help with logistics and all other technical aspects of the event. Furthermore, we involve our members of the association by organizing thematic workshops within EU Design Days and bring renowned speakers to help boost the quality of the event. 
 
Open Days 
The Open Days – European Week of Regions and Cities is an annual four-day event during which cities and regions showcase their capacity to create growth and jobs, implement European Union cohesion policy, and prove the importance of the local and regional level for good European governance.  
The Slovenian Business & Research Association has been involved in Open days since 2009. Our members include some of the largest and most prominent Slovenian cities and regions. We – alongside our members - have been involved in the organization of workshops, showcasing good practice cases and presenting keynote speeches.   
 
Info Days in Slovenia 
Every year we organize an EU information day event in Slovenia in cooperation with the Chamber of Commerce and Industry of Slovenia and the Ministry of Education, Science and Sport. Over 300 participants attend the event, to learn more about EU financing programmes and instruments (with a special focus on Horizon 2020). The event gets extensive media coverage in the Slovenian press, and is a useful annual platform for both participants from the public and private sectors. 
 
The University-Business Forum 
The University-Business forum, held almost every year since 2008, brings together higher education institutions, companies, business associations, intermediaries, and public authorities. It gives them a chance to meet at European level to discuss, network and exchange ideas and good practice. The Forum looks at the current situation in university-business cooperation and at what policy initiatives and programmes are needed to support this. The next European Forum will take place in Spring 2017. 
The Slovenian Business & Research Association has participated at all the events since its inception. This year, our member University of Ljubljana, presented a good practice case and showcased the university’s areas of strength in health, energy, advanced technologies and materials, and quality of life. The current rector of the university Prof. Ivan Svetlik also presented the Slovenian Innovation Hub as an innovation ecosystem framework which is supporting the deployment of the Smart Specialisation Strategy of Slovenia. 
 
MOST publication 
Most is a quarterly news bulletin published by the Slovenian Business & Research Association. Most, literally meaning “bridge” in Slovenian, is an up-to-date information source about the Slovenian economy, R&D activities, policies, statistics and regional news. The publication is targeted at Brussels stakeholders and sent to over 4,000 addresses. Among the recipients are all members of the European Parliament.  
 
Slovenian Innovation Hub 
The Slovenian Innovation Hub (SIH) was officially inaugurated on the 21st of May 2015 in Ljubljana, Slovenia. SIH will actively encourage knowledge-based development in fields where Slovenia has comparative and competitive advantages. The Hub initiators were the Slovenian Business & Research Association and the University of Ljubljana, with the full support of the Slovenian government. So far 23 members have joined, from both the business and research sectors.
